articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Visits Revolutionary Museum
articles.content:
Director of KPA General Political Bureau Visits Revolutionary Museum
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited the Revolutionary Museum in the historic site associated with the Fatherland Liberation War to learn in detail about the eternal preservation of historic buildings and management of them.
					 The commanding post of the Supreme Command in the site is associated with the great feats performed by the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung in winning the war. The system for eternal preservation of the commanding post has been completed in the run-up to the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War under the wise guidance of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the KPA.
					
					 After being informed of the work for sprucing up the commanding post of the Supreme Command and the housing compartment, the director learned about the preservation and management of several historic buildings including an office and study used by the President.
					
					 He then went round the museum, calling for completing the layout of academic data and giving diverse forms of lectures to the visitors.
					
					 The director said that the President matured the operational plan for bringing earlier the victory in the war by risking his life. This feat will shine long along with the commanding post of the Supreme Command, he said, calling for preserving and managing the commanding post to its original state on the principle of historicism.
					
					 Important in the education through the historic site is to make the people including service personnel and students realize the outstanding stratagem of the President and sagacity of his leadership under the situation on the front during the war.
					
					 He also called for organizing the visit in a meticulous manner as the number of the visitors has increased occasioned by the war victory anniversary.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-Do Team Leaves for Sofia
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-Do Team Leaves for Sofia
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Taekwon-Do team led by Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who doubles as chairman of the Asian Taekwon-Do Federation, left here on Friday to take part in the 18th World Taekwon-Do Championships to be held in Sofia.

articles.title: Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Upon authorization of the king and the great queen, a delegation of the Ministry of Royal Palace of the Cambodian government headed by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister for the Royal Palace, visited the DPRK embassy on July 7 and laid the floral baskets before  portraits of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kong Sam Ol said:
					
					 Although the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung passed away, he always lives in the hearts of all the Korean people.
					
					 I pray for the eternal life of Kim Il Sung on behalf of King Norodom Sihamoni, Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk and all the Cambodian people.

articles.title: Reception Given in China
articles.content:
Reception Given in China
 Beijing, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association gave a reception in Beijing on Wednesday to celebrate the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK Ambassador to China Ji Jae Ryong and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association Wu Donghe, Vice-President of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries Peng Zuoku and other officials concerned were present.
					
					 The chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association in his speech said over the past 52 years the two countries have always helped and supported each other in the spirit of the treaty. He went on:
					
					 In the new century the Sino-DPRK relations have made rapid progress and defended the common interests of the two countries. The Sino-DPRK friendship has grown stronger day by day, standing the test of history.
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship provided and cultivated by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries would steadily grow stronger thanks to the deep attention of the leaders of the new generation and the joint efforts of the two peoples.
					
					 Noting that the Korean people are building a thriving nation, rallied close around First Secretary Kim Jong Un and the Workers' Party of Korea, he wished them fresh, big successes in their efforts.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador said the two governments and peoples have dynamically pushed ahead with socialist construction in the two countries, consolidating the friendly and cooperative relations in political, economic, military, cultural and various other fields on the basis of the treaty.
					
					 It is the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the consistent policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship generation after generation, he noted. 
					
					 He said that the dear respected Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to steadily boosting the DPRK-China friendship, a precious common treasure of the two peoples, generation after generation.
					
					 This friendship will grow stronger under the deep care of Kim Jong Un and Xi Jinping and in line with the desires of the two peoples no matter how the international situation may change, he stressed.

articles.title: Reception Marks Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
articles.content:
Reception Given in ChinaReception Marks Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
 Beijing, July 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Beijing hosted a reception on Thursday to celebrate the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Li Haifeng, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, Liu Zhenmin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, the vice- minister of Culture, Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, Yang Yanyi, assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Present there were Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador recalled that leader Kim Jong Il put on a new high stage the traditional relations of friendship between DPRK and China which President Kim Il Sung provided and developed together with Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai.
					
					 He said that these relations have grown stronger generation after generation under the deep care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the respected Xi Jinping.
					
					 The ambassador sincerely wished the fraternal Chinese people greater successes in the efforts to carry out the socialist cause with Chinese characteristics under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Xi Jinping as its general secretary.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference recalled that the conclusion of the treaty 52 years ago from now marked a great event in the history of the relations between the two countries, noting that both sides have helped and closely cooperated with each other on the basis of the spirit of the treaty in the past period.
					
					 The two countries are the neighbors linked by the same mountain and rivers and the Sino-DPRK friendship provided and cultivated by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries is a valuable common asset, he noted.
					
					 China will promote the mutual confidence and understanding, steadily supplement and enrich the contents of the bilateral friendship and thus put spurs to the sustained, sound and stable development of the relations between the two countries in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future and strengthening good neighborly friendship and cooperation with the Korean comrades, he concluded.

articles.title: More Downpour to Hit DPRK
articles.content:
More Downpour to Hit DPRK
Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is likely to be affected by a strong rainy front between July 14 and 16.
					 According to weather forecast, it will rain more than 100-200 mm in Pyongyang, North and South Phyongan provinces, North and South Hwanghae provinces, Jagang, South Hamgyong and Kangwon provinces and more than 300-400 mm in some areas of the country.
					
					 A strong wind with speed of 10 meters per second is expected to hit most of the eastern and western coastal areas in the period and there will be tidal waves on the west coast.

articles.title: Downpour Continues in DPRK
articles.content:
Downpour Continues in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Downpour has continued in the central areas of the DPRK on Friday, too.
					 As of 06:00, 439 mm rainfall was registered on Masik Pass, 442 mm in Yangdok, 405 mm in Munchon, 403 mm in Popdong, 381 mm in Sudong District, 378 mm in Yodok, 376 mm in Kowon and Sinphyong, 372 mm in Anbyon, 356 mm in Koksan, 354 mm in Kosan, 345 mm in Hoechang, 344 mm in Chonnae, 339 mm in Wonsan, 335 mm in Sinyang, 320 mm in Sukchon, 316 mm in Phangyo, 304 mm in Tokchon, 301 mm in Kumya, 295 mm in Pukchang, 295 mm in Songchon, 288 mm in Maengsan and Phyongsong, 287 mm in Samsok, 280 mm in Sepho, 267 mm in Samdung, 262 mm in Unsan, 255 mm in Nyongwon and 252 mm in Thongchon.
					
					 Meanwhile, the water level of the River Taedong reached 6.65 meters as of 18:00 Thursday due to continued downpour and heavy rain. Its danger level is 8.8 meters.

articles.title: Flood Damage in Central Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Flood Damage in Central Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Flooding by downpour and heavy rains has brought damage to the central areas of the DPRK.
					 According to the results of an initial survey, torrential rain from 14:00 Tuesday and 18:00 Thursday left two persons dead.
					
					 120 blocks of dwelling houses were destroyed or submerged in Kangwon Province, 19 in North Hwanghae Province and 15 in South Phyongan Province.
					
					 An estimated 760 people were left homeless.
					
					 Meanwhile, more than 1,720 hectares of farmland were inundated in South Hamgyong, North Hwanghae and Kangwon provinces.

articles.title: Poster Published to Mark Victory in FLW
articles.content:
Poster Published to Mark War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A poster of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show was published to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. The show will be held with splendor in Pyongyang on the occasion of the anniversary.
					 The poster has main sculpture "Victory" of the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War engraved in bold relief against the background of blue sky. It is decorated with Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, a reflection of the boundless reverence of the Korean people and progressive mankind for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Seen in the poster are letters "Celebration of the 60th Anniversary of the Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War" and "Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show," the logo of the show and an explanation about its venue and period.

articles.title: New Process for Producing Zinc Oxide Built at Tanchon Smeltery
articles.content:
Zinc Oxide Production Process Built at Tanchon Smeltery
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Tanchon Smeltery built a big process for producing zinc oxide by use of by-products and successfully updated the first phase of the relevant liquefying process. 
					 They completed the construction of the new building in a brief span of time by their own efforts.
					
					 Hundreds of machines of more than 200 types were installed.
					
					 The liquefying process and zinc oxide production process are computerized.
					
					  A lot of equipment and materials provided by national institutions and the General Bureau of the Tanchon Area Mining Industry to the project and their aid given to help settle technical problems contributed to its successful project.
					
					 Mass-production of zinc oxide and remarkable increase of actual zinc extraction rate will help radically boost the production of quality nonferrous metal.

articles.title: Cemeteries of Fallen Fighters of KPA Reconstructed in DPRK
articles.content:
Cemeteries of Fallen Fighters of KPA Reconstructed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The cemeteries of fallen fighters of the Korean People's Army (KPA) in all parts of the country have successfully been reconstructed and their remains buried there on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The cemeteries have new gateposts, gravestones, wreath-laying stands and education grounds.
					
					 Seen on left and right sides of the gateposts of each cemetery are KPA cap-badge and flag of the DPRK. 
					
					 They bear letters "June 25, 1950" and "July 27, 1953." 
					
					 Engraved on red marble wreath-laying stands are Medal of Hero of the Republic or KPA cap-badge and laurel.
					
					 Carved on the front side of the gravestones are words "Grave of Fallen Fighters of the Korean People's Army" and seen on their back side are the names and number of fallen fighters. 
					
					 Buried at the cemeteries were remains of fighters of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces who laid down their lives for the Party, leader, country and its people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Formulates Postwar Reconstruction Plan in Wartime
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Formulates Postwar Reconstruction Plan in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Confident in victory in the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War, President Kim Il Sung formulated a far-reaching plan for postwar reconstruction in wartime and pushed ahead with its preparations step by step.
					 A meeting of world architects was held in Warsaw, Poland in Juche 41 (1952).
					
					 The general plan for the postwar reconstruction, which was presented by DPRK architects, drew close attention from the participants in the meeting.
					
					 All of them were deeply moved by the speech of a Korean delegate on how the plan could be mapped out in wartime.
					
					 In reference to the plan, world's media reported that the DPRK composed a symphony for war victory, undergoing U.S. bombings, and rose up on the debris.
					
					 On the order of Kim Il Sung, all of students who volunteered to join the army to fight against the U.S. invaders were recalled to universities to go on with study.
					
					 Technicians returned from the front to study in foreign countries and a meeting of scientists was held and the State Academy of Sciences established in the wartime.
					
					 Such measures could be taken only by Kim Il Sung, who had firm conviction of victory in the war.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Warm Love for Army, People in Wartime
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Warm Love for Army, People in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- During the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) President Kim Il Sung showed warm love for the servicepersons and civilians despite difficult conditions.
					 One day he unhesitatingly crossed a railway bridge over the River Rimjin, unafraid of enemy night air raid, to see soldiers of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 He took a step to provide servicepersons with bean-sprout soup, personally teaching how to rear bean sprouts, and wore a pair of soldier's winter padded shoes for over one week in hot summer to learn about their quality.
					
					 He delayed the start of the Seoul liberation operation for fear of possible damage to citizens and their properties if it was launched at night. During the temporary strategic retreat on the part of the KPA, he saw to it that many pieces of logs were floated on a river for firewood of Seoul citizens.
					
					 Besides, there were a series of measures taken by the President to stabilize the people's livelihood in wartime.
					
					 Under his orders, many servicepersons were mobilized to carry a large quantity of salt to farmers, military materials used for people's living and a military airfield turned into a vegetable field.
					
					 Meanwhile he saw to it that relief committees for war sufferers were set up and schools for the bereaved or orphaned children built across the country.
					
					 Such warm love of the President served as source of the army and people's heroism displayed in winning the war.

articles.title: DPRK Busy with Preparations to Mark War Victory Day
articles.content:
DPRK Busy with Preparations to Mark War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is seething with preparations for significantly celebrating the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					 Military organs, ministries and national institutions are cultivating flowers with sincerity to be displayed at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show marking the anniversary. A work is in full swing to spruce up the show venue on a large scale and in a peculiar way.
					
					 The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum is close to its opening. It will showcase the fighting spirit the Korean army and people displayed under the command of President Kim Il Sung to defeat the U.S. imperialist aggressors and defend the freedom and independence of the country in the war. Thanks to the devoted efforts of soldier-builders, officials concerned, creators and researchers, the museum has been rebuilt successfully in a short period to be a monumental edifice for conveying the President's feats for war victory, a base for anti-U.S. education and a center for education in the tradition of victories.
					
					 The Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of the Korean People's Army under construction in Pyongyang is nearing its completion, while similar cemeteries in other parts of the country are being rebuilt.
					
					 The servicepersons and civilians of the country bring about a great upsurge on all fronts of building a thriving nation, creating another "Masikryong Speed", to adorn the war victory day as a grand festival of victors.
					
					 Those servicepersons involved in the construction of the ski resort on Masik Pass wound up the laying of 10 skiing courses by raising the construction speed twice. They are now speeding up the project for widening roads and building dwelling houses, an underground parking lot, hotel and dozens of structures.
					
					 The Sepho tableland reclaimers carried out plowing of thousands of hectares and seeding in time in order to turn the tableland into a large-scale stockbreeding base.
					
					 Signal successes are also made in the construction of the Munsu Wading Pool, Mirim Riding Club and the second-phase Huichon Power Station, the projects for expanding the Kosan Fruit Farm and building the gravity-fed waterway in South Hwanghae Province and other major construction sites in the country.
					
					 The workers in the leading economic sectors, including light industry, are increasing the production.
					
					 Meanwhile, the preparations for such celebration events as the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" are going on at the final stage. The performance of "Arirang", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, is to start at May Day Stadium on July 22.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Branded as Group of Most Corrupt People
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Branded as Group of Most Corrupt People
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- South Korean people are labeling their regime as a group of most corrupt people, according to south Korean KBS on Tuesday.
					 More than 1 500 people across south Korea were polled by a south Korean relevant institution from September last year to March this year.
					
					 The results of the survey showed that the political camp including political parties and the "National Assembly" topped the list of scandals in various fields.
					
					 This eloquently proves that what strong resentment the south Korean people are showing at the puppet regime keen to meet its own interests by dint of power.

articles.title: Action for Peace against U.S. and War Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Peace against U.S., War Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The western team of the march group for peace which started in Kangjong Village, Jeju Province of south Korea launched an action for peace against the U.S. and war in Kwangju on Tuesday.
					 The group held a press conference outside the base of Combat Flying Corp No. 1 of the U.S. Air Force.
					
					 At the conference speakers deplored that the upkeep for the U.S. forces in south Korea is steadily increasing to surpass a trillion won.
					
					 They urged the "government" authorities to clearly know that to repeal a special agreement on sharing the upkeep of the U.S. forces is a starting point for putting an end to the humiliating relations with the U.S.
					
					 The eastern team of the march group held rallies for peace against war on the same day together with members of civic and public organizations in the region outside military bases in Pusan.
					
					 At the rallies speakers termed the U.S. forces an obstacle in the way of peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Underscoring the need to put an end to the vicious cycle of the war crisis through the conclusion of a peace treaty, they called upon broad spectrum of people to pool their efforts for peace and reunification.

articles.title: Remembrance Meetings Held Abroad
articles.content:
Remembrance Meetings Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of  Koreans in Kyrgyzstan held a remembrance meeting and Koreans in Uzbekistan an event on Monday, the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The participants laid flower baskets and bouquets before a full-length painting of Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il and portraits of the smiling leaders before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Pak Kyong Ho, chairman of the confederation, lauded Kim Il Sung as the most outstanding statesman in the 20th century and the tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 Kim Il Sung was an iron-willed commander who defeated two imperialisms in one generation and the great leader of the people who dedicated his all to the happiness of the people and the reunification of the country, Pak noted, and went on:
					
					 All the compatriots and world progressives miss the President very much because his idea and feats are great.
					
					 Ju Yong Il, chairman of the "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan, recalled that the President had always showed profound loving care for the overseas compatriots, adding: I can never forget the benevolent image of the President, who cordially met the compatriots visiting their homeland.
					
					 Though the President passed away, he will always live in the hearts of the compatriots and the world progressives for his great idea, immortal exploits and noble personality.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on its website on July 5.
					 The work, published on July 14, Juche 61 (1972), underscores the need to make strenuous efforts to implement the three principles of national reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity -- and indicates tasks and ways to do so.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Beninese Personage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Beninese Personage
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou on July 5 to mark the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 He said Kim Il Sung saw to it that the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government regarded service for the people as the fundamental principle of their activities and applied the people's will and wishes to politics. 
					
					 The exploits of Kim Il Sung will shine for all ages as he performed them by building a genuine people's country and socialist system centered on the popular masses with his original idea of nation-building and experienced and seasoned leadership, Ali Houdou noted. 
					
					 The Socialist Party of Benin expresses deep reverence for Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, and best wishes for his immortality, adding:
					
					 Thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of mankind.

articles.title: Remembrance Meetings Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Remembrance Meetings Held in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Guinea, Venezuela, Mongolia and Pakistan on July 4 and 5 to mark the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Present there were personages of the Guinean Rainbow People's Assembly, Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association, Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Venezuela-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, Venezuelan Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Kim Jong Suk Kindergarten of Mongolia, Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society and the Pakistan Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and masses. 
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Il Sung was the father of all people who gave unstinted material aid and moral support to people of different countries when they faced ordeals in the building of new society. 
					
					 Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Yecenia Garcia, chief of the Venezuelan Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, and other speakers praised Kim Il Sung as prominent leader who made undying contributions to accomplishing the human cause of independence. 
					
					 B. Baigalmaa, executive chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society, said he missed Kim Il Sung, a close friend of the Mongolian people, very much. He recollected with deep emotion the undying exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the friendship between Mongolia and the DPRK. He expressed his will to make positive efforts for development of the bilateral friendship. 
					
					 Mohammad Aslam Nagi, chairman of the Pakistan Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, lauded Kim Il Sung for turning the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Ukrainian Organization
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Ukrainian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea in Ukraine issued a statement on June 27 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The statement extended full support and solidarity to the service personnel and people of the DPRK who have turned out in the struggle to foil all the moves of the imperialists and build a thriving socialist nation, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea and under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who has successfully carried forward the revolutionary idea of the preceding leaders.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Korean war was ignited by the U.S. on June 25, 1950 to dominate the world under its direct command and this clearly proves that the U.S. has pursued a policy of aggression.
					
					 The Korean people could win a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War thanks to the wise leadership and unique war methods of President Kim Il Sung, who aroused all the service personnel and people to all-people resistance against the aggressors.
					
					 The politics being pursued by Kim Jong Un to realize the plan of the President and leader Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation provides a sure guarantee for successfully foiling any hostile acts of the U.S. and its satellite forces.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will invariably hold high the banner of the Juche idea in building an independent power, foiling any provocation by the enemies, and register bigger successes in their efforts to ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula and consolidate their socialist system.

articles.title: Nepalese Paper Introduces Memorandum Issued by History Society of DPRK
articles.content:
Nepalese Paper Introduces Memorandum Issued by History Society of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Ostito on July 5 carried the full text of the memorandum "The U.S. was the aggressor who provoked the Korean war" issued by the History Society of the DPRK on June 24 under the title "The provoker of the Korean war" on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 It was illustrated with photos documenting the invincible might of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae aboga por llevar bien cuidado de objetos historicos
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae aboga por llevar bien cuidado de objetos historicos
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ACNC) -- El jefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, averiguo en el terreno el estado de conservacion eterna y de mantenimiento de los edificios historicos del Lugar de Interes Historico de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					Gracias a la sabia guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Comandante Supremo del EPC, se ha establecido magnificamente, con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el sistema de conservacion eterna del puesto de mando de la Comandancia Suprema donde estan impregnadas las imperecederas proezas del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung por la victoria en esa guerra.
					
					Tras informarse del estado del trabajo para acondicionar bien el puesto de mando de la Comandancia Suprema y el edificio exterior, Choe hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de la conservacion y de la labor administrativa de varios edificios historicos como la oficina y la sala de estudio del Presidente.
					
					Pasando revista al Museo de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, donde apunto la necesidad de perfeccionar mas la distribucion academica del museo y hacer de diversas maneras las explicaciones segun las caracteristicas de los visitantes. 
					
					Dijo que seran inmortales junto con el puesto de mando de la Comandancia Suprema las imborrables hazanas del Presidente quien trazo el proyecto operacional para adelantar el triunfo en la guerra no haciendo caso del peligro personal. E insistio en conservarlo en estado original en el principio historicista.
					
					Lo importante en la educacion a traves de este lugar es ensenar a los militares y trabajadores de distintos estratos, en particular, a los jovenes y ninos escolares de nueva generacion, la destacada inteligencia militar y la sabia orientacion del Presidente, quien condujo a la victoria la guerra coreana, vinculandolas con la situacion de aquella contienda, puntualizo.
					
					Se tomo la medida para organizar con escrupulosidad la visita al museo de acuerdo con que se incrementa el numero de los visitantes con motivo del 60o aniversario del triunfo de la pasada guerra coreana.

articles.title: Continua lluvia torrencial en Corea
articles.content:
Continua lluvia torrencial en Corea
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ACNC) -- Prosigue hoy tambien la lluvia en la region central de Corea.
					  Las localidades donde se registraron hasta las 6 mas de 250mm de precipitaciones son las siguientes:
					
					  El desfiladero Masik (439mm), Yangdok (422mm), Munchon (405mm), Popdong (403mm), Sudonggu (381mm), Yodok (378mm), Kowon y Sinphyong (376mm), Anbyon (372mm), Koksan (356mm), Kosan (354mm), Hoechang (345mm), Chonnae (344mm), Wonsan (339mm), Sinyang (335mm), Sukchon (320mm), Phangyo (316mm), Tokchon (304mm), Kumya (301mm), Pukchang (295mm), Songchon (293mm), Maengsan y Phyongsong (288mm), Samsok (287mm), Sepho (280mm), Samdung (267mm), Unsan (262mm), Nyongwon (255mm) y Thongchon (252mm).
					
					  Por otra parte, debido a la lluvia torrencial, el nivel de agua en la cuenca del rio Taedong se elevo a 6.65m (nivel alarmante es 8.8m) hasta las 18 de la vispera.

articles.title: Se preven aguaceros en Corea
articles.content:
Se preven aguaceros en Corea
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ACNC) -- Se preve que Corea sera influenciada por el fuerte frente lluvioso desde el dia 14 hasta el 16.
					Segun aviso de un organo correspondiente, durante este tiempo caeran lluvias y aguaceros de 100-200mm en la ciudad de Pyongyang, las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y el Norte, Hwanghae del Sur y el Norte, Jagang, Hamgyong del Sur y Kangwon, parcialmente mas de 300mm y mas de 400mm en algunas zonas del pais. 
					
					En los dias 15 y 16, habria en cierto tiempo un fuerte viento de 10m/s en la mayoria de las regiones de la costa oriental y occidental.
					
					Se preve ademas tsunami en la costa occidental.

articles.title: Editado afiche dedicado a exhibicion de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Editado afiche dedicado a exhibicion de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ACNC) -- Se dio a luz el afiche alusivo a la exhibicion de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias que se efectuara en esta capital con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					El afiche describe la escultura "Victoria", tema principal del Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, con el cielo azul en el trasfondo, y las flores del sol florecidas plenamente por la veneracion del pueblo coreano y los demas progresistas del mundo hacia los grandes hombres. 
					
					Se ven las inscripciones "En celebracion del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria" y "Exhibicion de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias", el emblema, el lugar y el periodo de la exhibicion.
